alert.note: Alert for Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:26PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pender County through 200 PM EDT... At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Penderlea, or near Wallace, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Penderlea, Willard and Watha. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 388 and 393. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
